abstract: In many software applications, logs serve as the only interface between the application and the developer. However, navigating through the logs of long-running applications is often challenging. Logs from previously successful application runs can be leveraged to automatically identify errors and provide users with only the logs that are relevant to the debugging process. We describe a privacy-preserving framework that can be employed by Platform as a Service (PaaS) providers to utilize the user logs generated on the platform while protecting the potentially sensitive logged data. Further, in order to accurately and scalably parse log lines, we present a distributed log parsing algorithm that leverages Locality Sensitive Hashing (LSH). We outperform the state-of-the-art on multiple datasets. We further demonstrate the scalability of Delog on publicly available Thunderbird log dataset with close to 27,000 unique patterns and 211 million lines.
